page.title: 04ASHTON KEYNES TODAY
page.content: This pretty Cotswold village has the {Upper Thames,}crossed by numerous small bridges, running through it. The houses are a mixture of Cotswold stone cottages and modern houses. The school, built in 1870, has four classes with a total of just under one hundred children. At the age of eleven the children transfer to Comprehensive schools in Purton or Cirencester. Some go on to private schools. {Clubs.} The village offers a wide variety of leisure time activities. For the children there is Cub Scouts, Brownie Guides, Junior Church, and Football Club. For the adults there is Women's Institute, Mother's Union, Singing, Amateur Dramatics, Gardening Club, The Golden Years Club for the over sixties, and a variety of further education classes.
